aws_ec2_traffic_mirror_filter_rule.description: Provides an Traffic mirror filter rule

description.description: A description of the traffic mirror filter rule.

traffic_mirror_filter_id.description: ID of the traffic mirror filter to which this rule should be added

destination_cidr_block.description: The destination CIDR block to assign to the Traffic Mirror rule.

destination_port_range.description: The destination port range. Supported only when the protocol is set to TCP(6

protocol.description: The protocol number, for example 17 (UDP), to assign to the Traffic Mirror rule. For information about the protocol value, see [Protocol Numbers](https://www.iana.org/assignments/protocol-numbers/protocol-numbers.xhtml

rule_number.description: The number of the Traffic Mirror rule. This number must be unique for each Traffic Mirror rule in a given direction. The rules are processed in ascending order by rule number.

source_cidr_block.description: The source CIDR block to assign to the Traffic Mirror rule.

source_port_range.description: The source port range. Supported only when the protocol is set to TCP(6

traffic_direction.description: The direction of traffic to be captured. Valid values are `ingress` and `egress`

id.description: The name of the traffic mirror filter rule.
